UN whistleblower who exposed sexual abuse by peacekeepers is exonerated
Muslim women in the UK 'must integrate and speak English' says David Cameron

UK doctors say patients with multiple sclerosis (MS) are showing "remarkable" improvements after receiving a treatment usually used for cancer. About 20 patients have received bone marrow transplants using their own stem cells. Some patients who were paralysed have been able to walk again.
No. of suicides in Japan drops below 25,000 for first time in 18 years

Take back migrants or lose aid cash, Berlin tells North Africa: Germany’s Vice-Chancellor, Sigmar Gabriel, has threatened to withdraw aid from north African countries if they don’t cooperate on taking back rejected asylum seekers.
ISIS commits largest massacre since Syrian conflict by dumping 280 dead in the river and taking 400 hostages
A flower has bloomed in the zero gravity of space for the first time ever.
Women Forced to Work in Wartime Brothels Were Not Sex Slaves, Japan’s Foreign Minister Says - He prefers the term 'comfort women'
Largest ever longitudinal twin study of adolescent cannabis use finds no relationship between heavy use and IQ decline.
